title: [DREAMER] Standardize error handling in RLM runner
overview:
Error handling functions with 'any' parameters reduce TypeScript's ability to catch error handling bugs. The function should be more specific about what types of errors it handles.

**Motivation:** Proper error typing ensures all error cases are handled correctly and makes the code more maintainable. Error handling is a critical part of agent reliability.

**Success criteria:**
- Replace 'any' type in handleAxAIError with proper error union type
- Add type guards for specific error types (AxAI errors, network errors, etc.)
- Ensure all error paths are properly typed

**Technical constraints:**
- Depends on @ax-llm/ax error types
- Must handle both Error instances and non-Error values gracefully
- Cannot break existing error handling behavior

**In scope:**
- src/agent/rlm-runner.ts handleAxAIError function
- Type definitions for AxAI errors
**Out of scope:**
- Changing the actual error messages
- Modifying how errors are displayed to users

**Signals:** priority: low, urgency: Code quality - type safety in error paths
